key_insight: WorldCanvas fuses text, explicit trajectories (motion/timing/visibility), and reference images to generate coherent, controllable, promptable world events — combining semantic intent, motion control, and visual identity in one framework.
problem_solved: Bridges the gap between text-only event generation (which lacks fine-grained motion/timing) and trajectory-only image-to-video methods (which lack semantic intent and identity grounding), enabling user-directed, visually consistent event simulations.
method: Multimodal conditioning: accept natural language for semantic intent, explicit trajectories encoding motion/timing/visibility, and reference images for object identity.
Joint synthesis pipeline: fuse the three inputs into a single generative model that produces temporally coherent event sequences consistent with trajectories and visual references.
Control-focused design: expose trajectory parameters and text prompts for fine-grained user control over motion, timing, occlusion, and appearance.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a practical way to create interactive, controllable event simulations for animation, AR/VR, robotics, and dataset generation — improving fidelity and usability compared to single-modality approaches.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: inputs (text, trajectory, reference image) → fusion module → generated event/video frames
Timeline/trajectory graphic: annotated path showing motion, timing, and visibility/occlusion cues mapped to frames
Reference-to-output comparison: reference image(s) alongside generated frames to show identity grounding
Application icons: small visuals for animation, robotics, AR/VR, and data synthesis to show practical uses
paper_title: The World is Your Canvas: Painting Promptable Events with Reference Images, Trajectories, and Text
paper_authors: Hanlin Wang, Hao Ouyang, Qiuyu Wang, Yue Yu, Yihao Meng
